   191→     * A new transport version should be added EVERY TIME a change is made to the serialization protocol of one or more classes. Each
   192→     * transport version should only be used in a single merged commit (apart from the BwC versions copied from o.e.Version, ≤V_8_8_1).
   193→     *
   194→     * ADDING A TRANSPORT VERSION
   195→     * To add a new transport version, add a new constant at the bottom of the list, above this comment. Don't add other lines,
   196→     * comments, etc. The version id has the following layout:
   197→     *
   198→     * M_NNN_SS_P
   199→     *
   200→     * M - The major version of Elasticsearch
   201→     * NNN - The server version part
   202→     * SS - The serverless version part. It should always be 00 here, it is used by serverless only.
   203→     * P - The patch version part
   204→     *
   205→     * To determine the id of the next TransportVersion constant, do the following:
   206→     * - Use the same major version, unless bumping majors
   207→     * - Bump the server version part by 1, unless creating a patch version
   208→     * - Leave the serverless part as 00
   209→     * - Bump the patch part if creating a patch version
   210→     *
   211→     * If a patch version is created, it should be placed sorted among the other existing constants.
   212→     *
   213→     * REVERTING A TRANSPORT VERSION
   214→     *
   215→     * If you revert a commit with a transport version change, you MUST ensure there is a NEW transport version representing the reverted
   216→     * change. DO NOT let the transport version go backwards, it must ALWAYS be incremented.
   217→     *
   218→     * DETERMINING TRANSPORT VERSIONS FROM GIT HISTORY
   219→     *
   220→     * If your git checkout has the expected minor-version-numbered branches and the expected release-version tags then you can find the
   221→     * transport versions known by a particular release ...
   222→     *
   223→     *     git show v8.11.0:server/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/TransportVersions.java | grep '= def'
   224→     *
   225→     * ... or by a particular branch ...
   226→     *
   227→     *     git show 8.11:server/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/TransportVersions.java | grep '= def'

   233→     * In branches 8.7-8.10 see server/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/TransportVersion.java for the equivalent definitions.

    53→public class CohereService extends SenderService {
    54→    public static final String NAME = "cohere";
    55→
    56→    // TODO Batching - We'll instantiate a batching class within the services that want to support it and pass it through to
    57→    // the Cohere*RequestManager via the CohereActionCreator class
    58→    // The reason it needs to be done here is that the batching logic needs to hold state but the *RequestManagers are instantiated
    59→    // on every request
    60→
    61→    public CohereService(HttpRequestSender.Factory factory, ServiceComponents serviceComponents) {
    62→        super(factory, serviceComponents);
    63→    }
    64→
    65→    @Override
    66→    public String name() {
    67→        return NAME;
    68→    }
    69→
    70→    @Override
    71→    public void parseRequestConfig(
    72→        String inferenceEntityId,
    73→        TaskType taskType,
    74→        Map<String, Object> config,
    75→        ActionListener<Model> parsedModelListener
    76→    ) {
    77→        try {
    78→            Map<String, Object> serviceSettingsMap = removeFromMapOrThrowIfNull(config, ModelConfigurations.SERVICE_SETTINGS);
    79→            Map<String, Object> taskSettingsMap = removeFromMapOrDefaultEmpty(config, ModelConfigurations.TASK_SETTINGS);
    80→
    81→            ChunkingSettings chunkingSettings = null;
    82→            if (TaskType.TEXT_EMBEDDING.equals(taskType)) {
    83→                chunkingSettings = ChunkingSettingsBuilder.fromMap(
    84→                    removeFromMapOrDefaultEmpty(config, ModelConfigurations.CHUNKING_SETTINGS)
    85→                );
    86→            }
    87→
    88→            CohereModel model = createModel(
    89→                inferenceEntityId,
    90→                taskType,
    91→                serviceSettingsMap,
    92→                taskSettingsMap,
    93→                chunkingSettings,
    94→                serviceSettingsMap,
    95→                TaskType.unsupportedTaskTypeErrorMsg(taskType, NAME),
    96→                ConfigurationParseContext.REQUEST
    97→            );
    98→
    99→            throwIfNotEmptyMap(config, NAME);
   100→            throwIfNotEmptyMap(serviceSettingsMap, NAME);
   101→            throwIfNotEmptyMap(taskSettingsMap, NAME);
   102→
   103→            parsedModelListener.onResponse(model);
   104→        } catch (Exception e) {
   105→            parsedModelListener.onFailure(e);
   106→        }
   107→    }
   108→
   109→    private static CohereModel createModelWithoutLoggingDeprecations(
   110→        String inferenceEntityId,
   111→        TaskType taskType,
   112→        Map<String, Object> serviceSettings,
   113→        Map<String, Object> taskSettings,
   114→        ChunkingSettings chunkingSettings,
   115→        @Nullable Map<String, Object> secretSettings,
   116→        String failureMessage
   117→    ) {
   118→        return createModel(
   119→            inferenceEntityId,
   120→            taskType,
   121→            serviceSettings,
   122→            taskSettings,
   123→            chunkingSettings,
   124→            secretSettings,
   125→            failureMessage,
   126→            ConfigurationParseContext.PERSISTENT
   127→        );
   128→    }
   129→
   130→    private static CohereModel createModel(
   131→        String inferenceEntityId,
   132→        TaskType taskType,
   133→        Map<String, Object> serviceSettings,
   134→        Map<String, Object> taskSettings,
   135→        ChunkingSettings chunkingSettings,
   136→        @Nullable Map<String, Object> secretSettings,
   137→        String failureMessage,
   138→        ConfigurationParseContext context
   139→    ) {
   140→        return switch (taskType) {
   141→            case TEXT_EMBEDDING -> new CohereEmbeddingsModel(
   142→                inferenceEntityId,
   143→                taskType,
   144→                NAME,
   145→                serviceSettings,
   146→                taskSettings,
   147→                chunkingSettings,
   148→                secretSettings,
   149→                context
   150→            );
   151→            case RERANK -> new CohereRerankModel(inferenceEntityId, taskType, NAME, serviceSettings, taskSettings, secretSettings, context);
   152→            case COMPLETION -> new CohereCompletionModel(
   153→                inferenceEntityId,
   154→                taskType,
   155→                NAME,
   156→                serviceSettings,
   157→                taskSettings,
   158→                secretSettings,
   159→                context
   160→            );
   161→            default -> throw new ElasticsearchStatusException(failureMessage, RestStatus.BAD_REQUEST);
   162→        };
   163→    }
